commander.name: Unknown
commander.note: Commander name not found in available Tier 1/2 sources. Would require RAF Operations Record Books (AIR 27) access.

base: LG.89 (October), LG.104 (October-November), LG.13 (November), Bu Amud (November), Martuba 1 (November-December 1942)

variants.armament: 4× 20mm Hispano cannons (91 rpg), 2× 250lb or 2× 500lb bombs or 8× 3in rockets

sources: History of War - No. 274 Squadron (base locations: LG.89, LG.104, LG.13, Bu Amud, Martuba 1 for Q4 1942; operational timeline; fighter-bomber role from May 1942)
Wikipedia - No. 274 Squadron RAF (unit designation, battle participation El Alamein, Hurricane IIB/IIC variants October 1941-October 1943, operational overview)
Wikipedia - Hawker Hurricane variants (Hurricane IIC specifications: 4× 20mm Hispano, bomb loads, performance data)
Military Factory - Hawker Hurricane (Hurricane IIC technical specifications: Merlin XX engine 1,280hp, max speed 336mph, range 460 miles normal fuel, 920 miles with drop tanks)
Smithsonian NASM - Hawker Hurricane Mk IIC (armament: 4× 20mm Hispano cannons with 91 rounds per gun total 364 rounds)
WW2Aircraft.net Forums (RAF fighter squadron establishment: 12-16 aircraft typical for Desert Air Force, organized into A/B flights)
Web search - RAF Hurricane squadron organization (16 Hurricane aircraft standard for Western Desert Air Force squadrons in October 1942)
Imperial War Museums - No. 274 Squadron Hurribombers 1942 (photographic evidence of fighter-bomber operations, pilot briefings)
metadata.notes: No. 274 Squadron RAF transitioned to fighter-bomber role in May 1942 when Hurricanes were modified to carry bombs. Squadron operated mixed Hurricane IIB and IIC variants during Q4 1942. Squadron moved frequently during El Alamein and pursuit operations, relocating five times between October-December 1942 as Eighth Army advanced westward. Hurricane IIC 'Hurribomber' HL795/V photographed at Sidi Haneish and Sidi-Bu Amud in November 1942. Squadron primarily conducted ground attack missions during this period with minimal air-to-air combat. Personnel estimates based on standard RAF fighter squadron establishment. Specific combat records would require access to RAF Operations Record Books (AIR 27 series) at The National Archives.
metadata.witw_validation: WITW _airgroup.csv file not searched for this extraction. Further investigation needed for WITW game database cross-reference.

tier_1_sources_used: Web search - RAF squadron establishment (16 aircraft standard for WDAF squadrons October 1942)
Smithsonian NASM Hurricane IIC specifications (armament data)
tier_2_sources_used: History of War - No. 274 Squadron (base movements Q4 1942: LG.89 October, LG.104 October-November, LG.13 November, Bu Amud November, Martuba 1 November-December)
Imperial War Museums photographic evidence (Hurribomber operations 1942)
source_validation.corroboration_notes: Base locations confirmed via Tier 2 (History of War): LG.89 (October), LG.104 (October-November), LG.13 (November), Bu Amud (November), Martuba 1 (November-December). Fighter-bomber role confirmed via multiple sources including History of War (Hurricanes modified May 1942) and IWM photographic evidence. Hurricane variants (IIB and IIC) confirmed via Wikipedia with dates October 1941-October 1943, corroborated by IWM photo of Hurricane IIC HL795/V at Sidi Haneish November 1942. Squadron establishment (16 aircraft) based on Tier 1 web search data for WDAF squadrons October 1942. Personnel estimates based on standard RAF fighter squadron organization. Hurricane IIC specifications confirmed via multiple Tier 1 sources (Military Factory, Smithsonian NASM). Combat records are estimates based on squadron role and typical fighter-bomber operations during El Alamein.
research_gaps: RAF Operations Record Books (AIR 27 series) not digitally accessed for precise sortie counts and combat records

Flight commander names (A Flight, B Flight) not available
